intro: Angorkis campyloplectron, commonly known as the narrow-leafed grass. It is a perennial grass species native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plant features slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves that are typically less than 10 centimeters in length. Its flowers are arranged in spikelets, which are clustered in dense, cylindrical inflorescences. Angorkis campyloplectron is often found in open woodlands and grassy areas, where it contributes to soil stabilization and provides habitat for small invertebrates.
